WorkItem.Description: A cell with a leading zero number value will use data type numeric, which causes that value like '0001' will converted into 1 for excel. Values that are leading zero numbers should use data type string intead of number.
WorkItem.Summary: leading zero number values should have data type string instead of numeric

Comments.Message:
This shouldn't be mandatory. Not every user would want this: many would want numbers with leading zeroes converted to a straight number. Additionally, should the value be converted to a string with leading zeroes, or should it be stored as a number, and the format mask set to display it with leading zeroes.
In either case, using a cell binder would allow you to code exactly how you wanted this to be implemented.
